website_summaries.verdict: Though not all cat owners will find it reliable and there are some quality concerns, it's worthwhile when it works as intended.
pros: Provides the brand's stress-reducing action in a convenient diffuser for continuous soothing – useful for homes with multiple cats
Users who notice a difference in their cats' behavior are impressed with the results
cons: Limited use compared to the spray
A few reports of faulty units that leaked

customer_reviews.title: Big fan! Follow manufacture's guidelines for use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan! This helped with a crazy cat we had in the past, and it's working now on our sensitive, shy kitty. He is much more affectionate and calm. I will say though, be sure to really change it every 30 days! I waited a few days, thinking it was no big deal, and there was a small burn mark in the wick. It makes sense, if the wick can't suck up any more liquid and it will start to burn. I wouldn't say it's a safety hazzard if used properly- so use it according to their regulations! It's like letting a pot of water boil dry- you're going to burn your pot!
customer_reviews.author: Stasia SaysTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard!
customer_reviews.text: I got this item for my kitty who was having difficulty adjusting to a move and no longer being able to sleep in the bed with me. I'm not sure whether it worked or if she just adjusted on her own. However, after about two weeks of use, I started to notice this weird burning smell somewhere in the room where this was plugged in. I finally figured out that it was the diffuser--the device was pretty warm and had a nasty smell of burnt plastic. I don't see any visible melting of the device, but the smell was unmistakable. Thankfully Amazon it letting me return it. I hope the manufacturer addresses this issue because it's a fire hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Christina W.

customer_reviews.title: Could have burnt my house down!
customer_reviews.text: Came home to the smell of something "hot". Smelled like the dust of a furnace when it is first turned on for the year. We went through the house and couldn't locate where it was coming from. Then my daughter said, "look at the plug in! It is smoking!" I had read reviews stating it was a fire hazard but had assumed those folks had left the wick dry out. Mine was only plugged in for a few days and was smoking, so not a dry wick!! Also, it was leaking oil everywhere. So mad at myself that I didn't read reviews!! But glad we were home before something bad happened!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This item is a great idea if it actually plugged in and didn't get ...
customer_reviews.text: When I plug this item into the wall, it falls right back out. I ended up plugging it into a power strip on the floor so that it would stay plugged in and when I checked on it this morning (next day) it was hot. Not just mildly warm, just hot enough to cause worry to the point that I unplugged it and am now returning the item. This item is a great idea if it actually plugged in and didn't get super hot after only being plugged in for 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works! But watch for smoke.
customer_reviews.text: So, I'm pretty frustrated right now. This stuff has been a miracle for my elderly kitty who has started sundowning. Instead of anxious and yelling all night, she sleeps soundly, giving her (and the rest of us) so much peace. So while she breathes I will never not use this stuff. But yesterday, after putting a new container on the diffuser, it started to smell like burning. So while I'm really happy with the hormone part of this, I am NOT happy that I'm suspicious that the diffuser is a fire hazard or that I'm likely going to have to replace it frequently. So: five stars for the hormone, negative two stars for the potential death trap.
customer_reviews.author: bluestring

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this since I received it. . Yes all of our cats are spayed and neutered. We have three siblings cats. And one female that is not a sibling. . One or more of them were intentionally peeing outside of the litter box. . But since I have received this item we have not noticed them constantly peeing outside of the litter box. We would clean up the mess of P in a few hours later there would be another one so haven’t noticed since I have received this item. Never had anything like this before just going on what I have experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney j Findley

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard!!! Do not ignore the negative reviews!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this years ago and had to return it because the plug in caught on fire. I was hopeful they would have inproved the product over time because the plug ins actually catch on fire! So I decided to try again and monitor the room it'd be plugged in. It was fine for the first 25 minutes and then the room had the aroma of burning oil. I went to unplug it and noticed how extremely hot it was and saw that the oil was in fact burning on the plug in. Do not ignore the negative reviews. This product is truly unsafe to have in your home! Otherwise be extremely cautious!
customer_reviews.author: E Orzeck

customer_reviews.title: The diffuser continued to smell more and more like burning plastic
customer_reviews.text: We got this package and one refill package of the official Feliway brand (as in not 3rd party). We followed all the instructions, but both the included vial and the refill bottle were attached to the diffuser bulb and smelled like something was burning. As time passed the smell got worse. Many other people have had this issue too after researching. I threw it out after two weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Colson

customer_reviews.title: Gave my cat more anxiety
customer_reviews.text: When you first plug it in, it has a terrible smell that goes away after a day or so... but it caused the opposite response I was hoping for and my cat. She was acting especially strange after a week, but I left it for a while longer to see if that would change. After a few weeks, it feel out of the wall and this time I didn’t plug it back in this time and she has been so much calmer than when the product was plugged in. I think it was causing her more anxiety than without it. I was excited for this product but severely let down.
customer_reviews.author: Picklesandparots

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: This product is an ethanol base that perfume is in. it is toxic. Yes, the same ethanol found in gasoline. The insert even says so. While your pet is not eating it, the ethanol is going into the air. I suggest you buy an essential oil diffuser and some oils that are specifically made to sooth pets which is what I will do now. The feliway works but why expose your pet's air to toxins? was so disappointed when I found the info in the packaging that I threw it out..
customer_reviews.author: music mom

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this is in my head, but my two cats weren't "getting along", so I plugged in the Feliway diffuser and within days, things started quieting down. After a time, the kitties were fussing with each other again and when I checked the diffuser, it was dry, so I ordered another one, plugged it in and within a day or two, all was quiet. It HAD to be the diffuser! Now, I keep extras to always have on hand because I really believe its what's keeping my cats friendly. I now have a third cat and all three cats are tolerating each other!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I was initially so reluctant to spend the money to try this out after my vet recommended it, but wow what a huge difference it makes in my cat's anxiety. He is much more comfortable in his environment and is more enjoyable since he is no longer running and hiding from everyone. 100% worth a try - I was shocked at how well this stuff works.
customer_reviews.author: Cortney

customer_reviews.title: Took a while but it worked!
customer_reviews.text: My 16-year-old cat has been struggling with kidney disease and while he's getting the best care possible, he did start to mark. While the area he was making is on tile and is easy to clean up, I still don't want him doing it! I bought the Feliway and plugged it directly over where he was urinating. It took a little longer than I would have liked - almost a full three weeks, but he has stopped and seems to be less stressed.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Mesley

customer_reviews.title: Only used 10 hours
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it long enough to know if it would have made a difference for my cat or not. Certainly no difference during the 10 hours it was plugged in before I noticed how wet and greasy my electrical outlet was getting. You can't plug anything in above it or it will get wet and greasy too. My kuereg was plugged in above it and the plug was covered in hot feliway oil. It seems dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Well Worth A Read

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for all humans and doesn't work for all cats.
customer_reviews.text: The diffuser is to big, you can not use the other outlet no matter if you plug it in the top or bottom. It has been over a month and I have not seen a change in our cats. My 5 year old hopefully will mellow with age. I would also like to add I have discovered that I am sensitive to whatever is in this product. I have not noticed a cautionary note that some humans may have some type of reaction. I am not talking about accidentally get the liquid on your skin.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Never had an issue with the diffusers....
customer_reviews.text: The CEVA Classic works the best, IMHO, and when I get the "other" comfort zone, it doesn't work at all... I've been using it for close to 7 years I think, nary a problem.... THE PACKAGING says: Change the diffuser EVERY 3 REFILLS, so that's what I do -- it's more money, but worth it not to worry about burning the house down.... Made a HUGE difference in Gracie's life -- she's an anxious kitty, but is now happy, self confident and affectionate.... Can't say enough about this stuff...
customer_reviews.author: C. Lauster

customer_reviews.title: This has done a great job relaxing my cat
customer_reviews.text: This has done a great job relaxing my cat. He has anxiety issues- licking, licking, licking and also usually threw up once a day. Sometimes a hairball and sometimes his food- wet and dry. Have started using this product, limiting his wet amounts and also have purchased an automatic feeder that feeds him 6 times a day in small amounts. All this together has really helped Rudy become a better pet!!!
customer_reviews.author: JILL OLSON

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the risk - burned after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: I was SO excited to use this - my cat was instantaneously calm and I thought I found the solution to my problems. Unfortunately the diffuser itself is poorly made and got so hot after about 3 days of continuous use, and after about a week it started to smell like burning plastic. Not worth the risk to my home and family. These should be immediately discontinued and with all of the similar reviews I'm shocked that the liability is not enough to have done so already! :(
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Stopped my cat's inappropriate spraying
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked great for us. We have a cat who gets very territorial when other neighborhood cats come around and sprays curtains, walls, screen doors, etc. Since installing a couple of these units, the problem has taken care of itself. Kitty is now mellow and happy to go only in his litter box. A real life saver for me - and a money saver! Drape cleaning was getting expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Vet recommended, BUY IT NOW! IT WORKS!!
customer_reviews.text: After spending almost $500 at the vet to diagnose our kitty, they say that her symptoms are actually behavioral and most likely caused by stress. Ugh! The vet recommended this product by name so I came home and ordered it right away. Our girl is like a whole new kitty! No more "behavioral" problems, she's calm and happier and I've even seen a big improvement in her fur since she's no longer stressed out. This product really helped our kitty and I will be adding it to our monthly subscription. I highly recommend this for stressed out kitties!
customer_reviews.author: necij

customer_reviews.title: Helped!
customer_reviews.text: Helped my cat after his long relocation from Australia to Kentucky and into a home with two dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: great calming effects
customer_reviews.text: My kittie has lately been urinating outside his litter box. After doing some reading, I came to realize that it may have been anxiety related. So I ordered the kit & set it up in the largest open space of the house. AS far as I can tell he has not had one accident out side of the box since I started it. Great product! My only concern is that it does get warm & there have been some reports of fires so I keep it in an outlet out in the open & have not had any concerns for it getting too warm. My one negative is that it empties out quickly & has to be replaced frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Nita

customer_reviews.title: Smoke City
customer_reviews.text: We just got a puppy and wanted to do what we could to help our resident cat relax - I read these reviews 100x because of the feedback on these starting fire / smoking, and finally decided to take the chance (not all of them could be faulty, right?) WRONG! After a few hours of being plugged in our cat did seem calmer - BUT IT STARTED SMOKING! It was incredibly hot to the touch and smoke was clearly coming out of it. FIRE HAZARD.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this product for my cat who has been having adjustment issues. He was peeing outside the litterbox and waking me up constantly during the night with his meowing. I waited a week for results like the directions said. His behavior has been much better and he seems calmer. He peed once outside the litterbox. As for people claiming they are a fire hazard, I'm not sure what that is about. I followed the directions and the plug is warm, like it should be. Overall, I'm satisfied. The only reason I give it four stars is because my cat did pee outside the litterbox once. Hopefully that's the end of it though!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Smell of burning plastic
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended this product to help alleviate stress with our cats. After about 2 weeks with the diffuser plugged in to a central location in our living room, we started to smell a very strong odor of burning plastic coming from it. The diffuser was not only burnt but covered in the oily substance. Glad we discovered this when we did! Just wanted to share as a warning to others.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: My 19-year old cat gets happy when we have this product on
customer_reviews.text: My 19-year old cat gets happy when we have this product on; she gets animated and eats well. It last about 6 weeks and I just bought two more.
customer_reviews.author: Cauquenes

customer_reviews.title: I have a cat that is very intelligent. I had to study cat language
customer_reviews.text: It works. Some reviews say it catches fire in the outlet. I plugged it into an outlet that can be turned on and off at the wall. It's on during the day and off at night. I have a cat that is very intelligent. I had to study cat language, which is really just understanding what their tail positions mean. When she was done she'd bite scratch and sometimes attack. I've had to run a few times. She is much calmer now. Thank you Feliway.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to work well, but I would add that it does not have the same effect on every cat, so if you are a multi cat home, you might see varying results per cat. This item appears to work well, and, we have purchased refills and I've had no complaints so far. I recommend giving it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Layla S.

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS LIKE A VOODOO CHARM!
customer_reviews.text: Holy Smokes!! my cat was at war with my new pound rescue dog. he was marking everywhere and we were desperate. my vet recommended the nurture collar at first, and it didn't do a darnn thing... the vet then recommended this plug in... I thought no way, but I promise you- it's a miracle worker! I wish I could get a diffuser that does this for People lol so we went from cat stress pee zone, to harmony and co existence... I provided a photo visual as proof of the outcome! saved me fabric, made our cat happy again!
customer_reviews.author: Hunnechyle

customer_reviews.title: I was a skeptical.....at first!
customer_reviews.text: I have a female cat that was diagnosed with idiopathic feline urinary syndrome. Which basically means when she gets anxious or irritated she causes herself to have a UTI even though there's nothing physically causing it. The vet recommended I try this diffuser and I must admit I was extremely skeptical at first. Within the first week of it being plugged in there was a noticeable difference in both of our cats. They are both so much more sociable and calm! Hopefully combining this diffuser with a new cat drinking water fountain will greatly reduce, if not eliminate, her UTI problem. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Morris

customer_reviews.title: Not for my cat, opposite effect.
customer_reviews.text: I knew going in that this may not work. I had a female cat urinating outside of the box, was behavioral, not medical. I thought I would give this a try. First time, plugged in behind bed, started urinating on bed. Oh well. Put her in a cage for a week while I looked into other things. After she had adjusted, plugged in near her cage. Oh my! She was yowling st the top of her lungs, hanging off the top of the cage, unhappy 15 minutes after plugging in. Waited a bit, finally unplugged. 15 minutes later she was normal again. Not for my cat, maybe for others.
customer_reviews.author: Smile

customer_reviews.title: It worked...for the most part
customer_reviews.text: When I took in my sister's cat she had several behavior problems. The biggest one was urinating and marking around the house, which she did constantly but got especially bad when she went into heat. The diffuser definitely helped most of the time with this problem except when she was in heat--which was easily remedied by a trip to the vet. Any other behavior issues she has are attributed to her being an idiot and nothing fixes that, but we love her anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Mellow kitty
customer_reviews.text: I have a used-to-be-feral kitty. Though she was only 6-month old when I adopted her 4 years ago, the rough early life has rendered her skittish and unfriendly towards my two other cats and this human. I started using the Feliway two weeks ago as recommended by the vet. I can see certain improvement in the kitty's behavior already. She is much more friendlier and relaxed. She behaves more like a normal cat (if there is such a thing) instead of being in a "fight or flight" state of mind all the time. The whole household is more peaceful, and I am grateful for that.
customer_reviews.author: F. C.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fire Hazard - DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: Bought three of these for each floor in our home before reading the reviews posted about the product being a fire hazard. I had these diffusers plugged in for a little over an hour. They were hot to the touch and smelled like burning plastic. I am returning these and do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: emits burnt odor - defective? fire hazard?
customer_reviews.text: Tried this because my cat is compulsively licking the fur off her belly and legs. After being plugged in a couple of hours, the diffuser smells strongly like burnt toast. It was quite hot to the touch. I was not comfortable leaving this plugged in overnight or unattended...which is large portions of the day when I am at work or asleep -- and times when my cat probably needs soothing the most. I am not confident this product is safe. I tried it in 2 other outlets, and it did the same thing. When I asked about it, other users reported no odor -- so I suspect there is something wrong with this one. I returned it with no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Joot

customer_reviews.title: Miracles Exist!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this diffuser because one of my cats, who is the cutest little furry pumpkin ever, has a very nervous temperament. It makes medicating and transporting him nearly impossible, and lately it's gotten worse to the point that even brushing him (which he used to love) has become a challenge. This morning I plugged in the diffuser. This afternoon my pumpkin happily let me brush him while he rolled around and purred. I'm thrilled. I've always been worried about how his anxiety would affect his health in other ways, and I tried other methods for calming him, but for a cat who quickly gets suspicious of medicated 'treats,' this worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: Jetpack39G

customer_reviews.title: Calms cat in heat while waiting for spay surgery.
customer_reviews.text: To our shock, our new shelter adoption just had kittens & now nursing. Then went into heat almost immediately. She is MISERABLE. Thankfully this product calmed her down within an hour. Will use until the vet says it is safe to spay her after kittens are weaned. Note: This is not designed for large areas. It is being used in a very small bedroom where the kittens are with window closed and door slightly open. Yes the diffuser does get hot because it heats the oil. So i recommend monitoring and using for a couple of hours at a time, and replace refill when oil is low. Thankfully, it arrived in two days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product became dangerous to leave around my cats.
customer_reviews.text: I had one Defusser that worked. The 2nd one started to heat up and bubble over from defusser. Same electric outlet and same area. I had to throw away. If I had not been out there where it was leaking my cats would have eaten the liquid and it is toxic. Everyone needs to know how dangerous this is to use even if you are watching . It only takes a drop to kill a cat. I did try a 3rd one and as soon as it got warm it did the same thing. Dangerous. I did tell my Vet and he said he had heard from other client s the same thing recently.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Rushing

customer_reviews.title: The magic elixir for a high strung cat
customer_reviews.text: I do alot of fostering. One male cat does can not handle this. Instead of a few days, he goes crazy for months. We tried tranquilizers to help this guy, nothing worked until I found this product. I literally plugged it in the first time and with in minutes the kitten I was fostering was safe in the same room with him. I since have pulled the Feliway out when needed. I have recommended this product to several other rescuers, a friend who had a cat with litter box problems. It is not a cure all, but each has used it repeatedly. It is expensive, but I find very worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kimlaw

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived quickly and in good shape. Other reviews mentioned leaks and/or broken pieces ...
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived quickly and in good shape. Other reviews mentioned leaks and/or broken pieces and I had no issues there. Only problem was the cat. He seemed to try to avoid it, moving into whatever room it wasn't in. He's old and little jumpy lately - I was hoping it would relax him, but didn't seem to make any difference. I'll try it again, just before the next vet visit.
customer_reviews.author: dicegirl

customer_reviews.title: It seems to have calmed them down a bit...
customer_reviews.text: As the room fills with the hormones, the female cat fell asleep, the male slowed down a bit. The kitten...no immediate affect! It's been operating for a couple weeks now, and all 3 seem to be getting along a lot better. It takes the edge off for sure, does it solve the whole problems with integrating the kitten, probably not. Tolerance is building with the male and the kitten. It helps to integrate food/feeding times, petting times, and TLC times with all 3 of them. Play time is also important.
customer_reviews.author: Wingman

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats!
customer_reviews.text: This plug in has absolutely no scent, looks like any regular plug in and works! The price tag on Amazon vs the $40 in store is great too, especially if your skeptical. We bought this because our kitten was peeing in the living room and very aggressive towards our dog. While this plug in didn’t effect my dog after a week I noticed a big decline in hostile attacks on my dog. We did combat the peeing problem with a citrus deterrent but there’s been no accidents! I will be buying refills and I would recommend to someone facing a kitty problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Stout

customer_reviews.title: Has stopped cat from marking territory with pee
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try and curb my cat's bad habits of peeing everywhere and scratching everything. She is really territorial and has been peeing and scratching her whole life of 4 years. It has been a long journey, but I didn't want to give up. That being said, I have had the plug in for about 3 months now and I haven't found any new pee spots, though she does still scratch everything. However, I think this is worth every cent, if it really has made her stop peeing on my stuff/house. The only downfall is I can't plug in anything above the diffuser or it will get liquid all over the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Really helped our 14 year old cat calm down.
customer_reviews.text: Not even exaggerating!! Our 14 year old cat was not happy. Started spraying, howling, very stressed out. We had a flood the day after this arrived. The cat walked through water raining from the kitchen ceiling to eat/drink. Lots of people came and went to demo. We had 19 fans and dehumidifiers around the house. He calmly walked passed them and slept without a flinch. It definitely works! No more peeing on the rugs, no more spraying. It helped to relieve this stress so we can take care of the other challenges 2020 has provided us. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Miss my kitty
customer_reviews.text: This helped to make my late cat's last month of life more comfortable. She was more relaxed and at peace in the room we used it in. That gives me a little more comfort during this sad time.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Diffuser to help deter bad behavior of elderly cats.
customer_reviews.text: I have noticed no change in my elderly cats behavior. Maybe it's their ages, but it did not seem to make any difference at all. After a few weeks I began to smell something "hot," or "burning," when I walked by the diffuser. I had read other reviews before purchasing regarding the potential to burn, and decided I needed to take the diffuser our. When I pulled the diffuser from the wall socked, it felt hot to the touch. This product was entirely too expensive to not deter the behavior and, to have the worry of a potential fire hazard.
customer_reviews.author: HJNTEX

customer_reviews.title: Highly advise against this product. Go for the spray.
customer_reviews.text: This nearly caught fire. After only a day of having them plugged in (I purchased 3) they all started burning. I don't have faulty outlets or wiring, this was strictly the diffusers. Thanks to Amazon Customer Service, I'm returning the burnt plugins and getting my money back. For costing so much, you'd think they'd be worth it, and a little more effective.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS! DIFFUSER OVERHEATS EVEN WITH FULL BOTTLE!
customer_reviews.text: The Feliway pheromone seems to work pretty well when sprayed on a cloth and left near a cat’s problem area. But there is a HUGE and dangerous overheating problem with the plug-in diffuser. It seemed to work initially, and after we used up one bottle we installed a refill. A week later I went to unplug it and burned my thumb on the diffuser. It was absolutely red hot! I used a cloth to pull it from the socket and when it cooled off I threw it in the trash. DO NOT USE THIS DIFFUSER! It is a fire hazard and a burn hazard for children and pets.
customer_reviews.author: EusebiusTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Wtf is this
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this in today and my cat had a very negative reaction. He got extra territorial and attacked my Great Dane out of nowhere. This is extremely dangerous for a small animal to behave in such a way. Now my dog is having anxiety about the cat and I’m awake at 3am trying to calm her down. I’ve used feliway before with NO problems. Seriously wtf is this, a new formula?
customer_reviews.author: Mandie

customer_reviews.title: NOT SOMETHING I WOULD BUY AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this in for my cat in the room where his litter box is located. He has always been timid to go to this room, to use the litter box. I still don't understand why, there is nothing scary in there, it is a laundry room with a washer/dryer/freezer. I hoped this product that claimed to be a relaxing thing for the cat, would work, and he would not seem to be so wary to go in and pee! It didn't work. Cat behavior has not changed, and the plug in has been there about 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: LADYRIDER

customer_reviews.title: Makes cat chill out
customer_reviews.text: My cat is high strung and hates my energetic dog. The dog leaves the cat alone but the cat isn’t having any of his nonsense. He gets stressed induced UTIs. This makes my cat chill af. He found my hairbrush and started rubbing himself on it and started drooling. Stopped caring about the dog altogether. No smell. No noise. Only negative is that it covers both electrical sockets and the oil leaks if you take it out To plug something else in. The defuser is round so you can not set it on anything and there is no switch to turn it off. So it’s diffusing 24/7. Despite that, I still think it’s worth it. 5 Stars
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: If you have cat allergies, be prepared.
customer_reviews.text: I got a new kitten a week or so ago and the cat and him were making ok progress but she wouldn't stop hissing at him. Well the picture shows what happened the day I plugged this in. Cuddled most of the night together :) The package (both packing bag and product box) were opened when I got it though. Another thing to keep in mind is I have cat allergies (getting used to the kitten currently) and this product makes my allergies A LOT worse. I'm hoping to get used to it the same way I do individual cats but we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Zabeth

customer_reviews.title: Not Safe
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the deal is. We used this product for our cat issues with no problems when we were first married. Fast forward 15 years and we have a new set of cat problems. I didn't want to believe that the mixed reviews could be true so we tried it again. It worked fine for the first day, but this evening we began to smell a burning smell and it was coming from the diffuser. We will definitely be returning this defective product. We are disappointed, and baffled. We will stick with the spray I guess. It's more work and doesn't work as well, but it's better than a house fire!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Miksa

customer_reviews.title: So far... so good
customer_reviews.text: The 6 year old cat we adopted from our local AHS, had been in that shelter for 6 years... so we decided to add her to our two 3 yr old male cats. (YES they are all FIXED!). They weren't impressed w/ each other, she kept "missing the litter box" for her Poo, she continued to hiss at them even if they weren't any near to her than 5 feet! Our Vet recommended these products to help 'calm her down'. It's been 3 weeks and things are gradually improving, especially the 'elimination' part.
customer_reviews.author: Geegee Seven

customer_reviews.title: Leaked,  Defective, Not very effective
customer_reviews.text: I went to check on the product to st if I needed to order a refill. I figured it was close to 30 days and my cat was showing more stress behaviors. What I found is that this product LEAKED out of the diffuser through the top and dripped down on everything that was below it. It had left a permanent stain in my hardwood floors. My cat, while she seemed a little less stressed recently, is still stressed, losing hair, and looking to chew on plastic as a comfort activity. I an boy happy schoolboy the damage caused by the default product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer D

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: There was actually no scent from this diffuser which is really good. I have 3 adult cats - my mother moved in with me with 2 adult cats. This product did not work with any of the cats. There was still major aggression, spitting and hissing from all five cats. The product says it work on 9 out 10 cats. Well, i had 5 and it didn't work for any of the 5 after 3 weeks of use. Definitely not worth the money we paid.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This did absolutely nothing for my cat, he sprays and marks territory, and I was hoping this would help but it didn't, all it did was get REALLY hot in the plug in. Now it never caught fire or smoked but it got SUPER hot, so I was afraid to leave it plugged in. Wish I could have my money back, not worth it! I wanna try the spray because I've heard great things about that but I'm just not sure I want to give them more money. I'll update if I decide to get the spray!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: I guess it works?
customer_reviews.text: I think it works? I haven't seen a huge difference in my cats, but they have seemed a but more mellow since we started using Feliway. I did a good bit of googling to find something that would help them get along a little better. I was under the impression this would help. So I was a bit confused when the box said "not to be used with aggressive cats." I used it anyways, and we do seem to be getting more napping, and less growling. I cwnt smell it at all. Haven't noticed any issues with it plugged in at all.
customer_reviews.author: Elyse

customer_reviews.title: leaks
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these diffusers, one for each floor of my small house. I plugged them both in (yes they are right side up-I saw the company's response to others that complained of leaking) and noticed less than a week later they were both leaking. I tightened them up and the one downstairs no longer leaked but the one upstairs continued to leak. In fact I cant tighten anymore -it just spins. So the ligiid lasted less than 2 weeks and it is quite costly to replace-$15/ month for just one. There has to be another product that is more reliable!
customer_reviews.author: uvarunner

customer_reviews.title: Worked right away
customer_reviews.text: My cat had surgery a month ago, and then a couple weeks later I went away for a week for Christmas and left him with a cat sitter. When I got back, he was really distraught and kept meowing almost incessantly for days, and he is usually very quiet and content. It seemed the surgery and my absence triggered his anxiety, so a couple friends recommended the Feliway diffuser. It started working that very night! Now he's back to being my peaceful, happy kitty. I've had it plugged in for a few days so far. I'm in a 400 square foot studio, so the one diffuser seems to reach all parts of my apartment.
customer_reviews.author: S. Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it and say THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.text: We were temporarily sent to a hotel with our dog and cat and my daughter wanted me to purchase this product to help with the stress ... I’ve never seen such a transformation in our cat’s personality. She’s kind of normally standoffish but after using the plug-in she kept getting in bed and cuddling next to me and purring and also rubbing against me and wanting me to pet her. In the year and a half she’s been a family member she’s NEVER done this. We HIGHLY recommend this product. I’ve never seen anything work like this.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly D. Early

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We got this after my cat started literally peeing blood from the stress of having a new dog. Now all 4 cats get along better than ever, everyone is healthy, and they are way more tolerant of the dog. The diffuser does get hot, and we obsessively check the oil level so we don't burn it out. A safer delivery system would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mystee

customer_reviews.title: My cat got sick
customer_reviews.text: Had it in for less than a week and my cat, who has never been sick before, became very ill. I figured that this was the only thing that has changed in her life and unplugged it, a few days later she was eating, drinking, not hiding behind the couch. I am really bummed my friend recommended this for me, it worked for her cats, but I guess it's not for all cats. Sorry I wanted to like it but I do not recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: KimberlyNichole

customer_reviews.title: The difuser gets blazing hot very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: The other diffuser available has a heat cut off, this diffuser got blazing hot, I would never buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this FELIWAY diffuser on November 20, 2019. I waited awhile before writing a review because I kept hoping the cats behavior would improve. I kept thinking, maybe today’s the day !!! I had high hopes for this FELIWAY Diffuser but I am very disappointed. I put one in the living room and one in the bedroom - pretty much where both cats stay. When I realized it was working and effecting the cats’ behavior I put BOTH into 1 room - bedroom. That hasn’t helped. The cats behavior has not changed at all. Do not waste your money. If I could have given it NO stars I would have.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Made things INFINITELY worse
customer_reviews.text: This immediately made my cat so much worse. He's got anxiety already and I was hoping for a non-medicinal way to calm him. The vet suggested this. brand specifically. Since plugging this in he became infinitely worse. Sometimes he tries to play with our feet but this time, he attacked my face while I was sleeping and he was so anxious, he would not stop biting his own feet for hours on end. It was really distressing. As soon as I unplugged it and aired out the house, he calmed down. I am going to try a catnip diffuser next and see if it has any better results.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: It didn't have the impact I anticipated.
customer_reviews.text: I put it in my bedroom (I just moved and my cat was hiding in my room all day/night). After plugging it in within 24-48 hours, she wouldn't go back into my room, AT ALL. I wasn't banning her from the bedroom, I just wanted her to come out of the bedroom during the day. After moving it, she would go back in the bedroom, but not in the room it was plugged in...so I stopped using it completely so she'd continue to investigate and become familiar with all the new surroundings. I couldn't smell it at all so I rated scent a 5.
customer_reviews.author: CaliB

customer_reviews.title: Not Super Affective/ Expensive!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for a new cat I had recently adopted from a shelter as she was having separation anxiety after being dropped off the day prior by her ex owners. It doesn’t seem to be super affective but she has improved a small amount. Maybe it takes a bit longer then a couple weeks for it to work in leaps and strides. It’s quite expensive for the amount you get though. It’s like charging someone a dollar a day to use it. I’d much rather purchase super affective CBD oil for animals then this. Up to you though!
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a believer! I have 8 cats and some of them have been peeing on my new wood laminate flooring. They were driving me crazy! This stuff is definitely working. The problem has not been totally eliminated but there are FAR FEWER incidents. If you are having a problem with your cats, you should try this!
customer_reviews.author: Catlady

customer_reviews.title: Really calms my cats down
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my vet to help my 2 cats adjust to a new house, and it's working well. They seem calmer now that I am using it. You need to get them for more than just one room if your cats roam the house. I have them located in places where they have had altercations in the past, and they seem to help. The review asked about scent--I usually can't smell the pheromones. Another product that I tried smelled kind of stong. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Book Diva

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted this to work.
customer_reviews.text: It did not, not even close, no change whatsoever. Just to be sure, I moved it around the room to get maximum control. My pee-head cat still pees everywhere, he even slept right next to this, and then he peed. I totally expected him to just pee right on it to show his superiority. I was thinking of hanging it from his collar but I think he would have just peed on it. It was a waste of time and money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Philm

customer_reviews.title: My crazy cat is much happier
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that is easily offended by visitors. She refuses to go into hiding like most cats. Instead, she makes her presence known with hissing and other unpleasant noises and attitudes. I combine the use of this Feliway Classic Calming Diffuser for Cats along with the Sentry Calming Collar for cats, and they are both in use 24/7. The two products together have notched her anxiety way down. It has been a good aid for her anxiety; and as a result, my life is better, too.
customer_reviews.author: In My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: No more cat spraying!
customer_reviews.text: Behavioral marking (cat spraying) against my back wall (house) windows (on my 12 foot velvet drapes, nonetheless) completely stopped after using this! So excited! Our Vet recommended this product after we couldn’t determine the cause of one of my female cats marking.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S Dawson

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: We have one sketchy little kitty cat that is a bit nervous and would mark inappropriately. After taking her to the vet, and finding she had no UTI the vet suggested Feliway. They had a spray in the office and it seemed to be working on my kitty right there and then. Bought these plug in diffusers and within a week my little sketchy cat was calm, more affectionate, and no longer marking inappropriately. This stuff is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy R.

customer_reviews.title: Going with something else
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to help? Especially now that it's not anymore, the difference in noticeable. However, I still have half a refill left and.... it's been like that for three weeks now. My refill got messed up because of address changes and I didn't get it. Aaaaaand I'm glad it did because the diffuser isn't working anymore. I saw there was another type so we're gonna go with that and hope for a longer lasting product since this one couldn't even make it 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: but multiple friends (and the humane society) recommended we try this to help our (rather neurotic) cat
customer_reviews.text: I was VERY skeptical about this product, but multiple friends (and the humane society) recommended we try this to help our (rather neurotic) cat. After 30 days, he is a totally different cat! He isn't terrified of his own shadow anymore. I'm definitely a believer now.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Cat diffuser
customer_reviews.text: The cats noticed it the very first day, and the neutered male actually used the kitty litter box instead of the pee pad, but after a couple of days, they got used to the smell and he went right back to his pee pads. I will not be buying refills. I did use the spray of the same brand because he would tend to use the kicked out litter on the floor while I was at work, so he moved from that litter box to the next one. I just sprayed around the 2nd box in the house, we'll see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: 98northwood

customer_reviews.title: I'm not repurchasing this...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. Plugged it in and started smelling like something was burning. Went to take it out and the plastic was hat to the touch. Let it cool off over night and tried it again with the same situation. So, I had to return it. I'm sure I just got the default one but, I'm not taking a second chance on rebuying it.
customer_reviews.author: ALASKA 907

customer_reviews.title: Does work. Keep using it for at least 2 to 3 months to ensure cat adjusts to new home, and relaxes.
customer_reviews.text: Probably best way to help cats adjust to a new situation. I have one in every room. But now that we are going on the fifth month since I adopted them, will stop using them, and see if that makes a difference. Will report back to let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Laura G.

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is magic!
customer_reviews.text: I've used Feliway in the past with success but not in several years. I was pleased to find this much cheaper than I remember it. I also love the updated design that allows the plug part to be rotated. I have two diffusers in my house right now and they appear to have soothed my older cat as he's adjusting to the new kitten. He has a history of bladder stones so his go to when he's mad is to pee inappropriately. With the diffusers in the house, this behavior has stopped.
customer_reviews.author: RamonaMeadBlogger

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS! Started smoking
customer_reviews.text: As others have said this is DANGEROUS. I used it a few months and on my most recent refill (a FULL bottle of liquid, from THEIR brand) and my boyfriend goes “uh... is that thing supposed to give off a mist?” Ran over and unplugged it - it was SMOKE! I had read reviews and decided to take chances anyways but I am glad we saw it smoking. Burning your house down is not worth the risk. Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Little expensive but completely works!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old female cat was losing hair on belly. Vet could find nothing wrong. Bought this diffuser and my cat is calmer and hair growing back on belly. SO GRATEFUL!!!! Alittle expensive since needs refilled monthly but totally works.
customer_reviews.author: danmo

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the safety/efficiency of the product
customer_reviews.text: Pros: definitely made my cat more calm Cons: started smelling something after the second month, thinking it was the pheromones, when it turned out that the diffuser was actually starting to burn internally, and even cracked a part of the plastic inside that holds the cartridge. Don't think I'll be using this product again despite recently purchasing more oil. Not sure if I am using it incorrectly, but there is always oil left over when I change cartridges. If not unsafe then definitely inefficient at best in oil diffusion.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and gets very, very hot
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these and have used both in multiple rooms trying various outlets. They drip on the floor and get incredibly hot to touch and we can smell the warmed plastic. I’m trying to find another good company and plug in for our cats.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Kelly Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Best price Ive seen for this product!
customer_reviews.text: So far I've used this plugin for a week. My cats have anxiety and they are scared of everyyything. They hide from every noise and run from our feet. Since using the Feliway plugin I noticed they don't hide as often, and they don't run as much from feet. However, I did notice my 2 cats are fighting and getting territorial of certain spots in the house. This is actually supposed to stop this behavior, but they never even fought before putting this in my house. Overall id say I need some more time, but it seems to be helping with the major issues. This is also the cheapest price I've seen this offered at!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: No longer urinating outside of litterbox
customer_reviews.text: I have a young male cat who used his litterbox most of the time, but would pee in other areas of the house on occasion too, usually near a window. I'm guessing seeing critters outside may be causing this reaction, so I decided to give Feliway a try. I got it in mid-July 2019 and there hasn't been an incident since! If you are having similar issues - give this a try!
customer_reviews.author: Jen Rose

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes It Works, Sometimes It Don't
customer_reviews.text: I had to use this until my adolescent cat got neutered because he was peeing on everything. The vet recommended it. It might have helped a little bit but the real solution was the neuter. I always worry that these can get too hot. I tended not to leave it plugged in if I had to leave for any long periods of time. This is probably why it didn't work as well as it should. I've used it in the past to calm cats down and it worked well for that but did not work for calming two cats who hated each other.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fisher, Retired Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: When I began packing to move, my cats were beginning to frantic. My coworker recommended looking into a calming product and I found this that I could use at the old house while packing and then at the new house to make the transition easier. It was such a smart purchase! I was so grateful for this and I definitely feel that it helped my fur babies transition into our new home much easier.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoRose85

customer_reviews.title: I Bought It, Cat Doesn't Seem To Notice
customer_reviews.text: Think it works better for my peace of mind than the cat's. Cat seems not to get the idea even though I've explained the concept numerous times. I just get a blank, almost nonchalant stare that's very similar to the look I get whilst trying to explain to my GF Kim why the smallish bathroom can't be expanded into the adjoining bedroom. Same reaction, same stare...ugh!
customer_reviews.author: Carter Clough

customer_reviews.title: Hot to the touch and absolutely no change
customer_reviews.text: $35 a piece just to get overly hot and greasy (the label melts off) and have absolutely no change in behavior. I have wondered about Feliway for years, now I can consider it my $70 seminar on wasting money. Hooray.
customer_reviews.author: Kat S.

customer_reviews.title: Night and day.
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a new cat and I knew he'd have to get used to the place, but he was driving me crazy. Bellowing at night, tossing litter from the box and hiding under the TV stand. Now, it's like he's been here for years. Within two days, the bellowing stopped and he was walking with tail erect. He was comfortable and turned out to be a total cuddle bug. I was floored. I've been keeping an eye on the difusser with the reports of fire and, while it does get warm, I haven't had it gotten hot enough to burn. For a new pet or just an anxious one, I recommended this 100%
customer_reviews.author: Imo

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my cats calm.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for years. I have recently started replacing my diffusers, even though they are still working. I have read where you are supposed to replace them every 6 months or so. Too expensive. I have never had a problem with them, and I notice a difference in my cats when they run out. By the way, the last few drops take forever to use, so I usually replace them with a new Feliway then. It would be nice to be able to use those last few drops as they are not cheap. They do get a little warm to the touch when plugged in, but nothing I would worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I moved and one of my cats is having a very hard time adjusting. Normally he's timid but extremely affectionate. After the move, I would see him under the bed more than anywhere else. He would run away from me crouched down and wild-eyed. This absolutely helped. With the use of a calming pheromone collar, he's practically back to his pre-move self. Also I can't smell it, which is nice. I may end up using this for some months.
customer_reviews.author: VirginianHannah

customer_reviews.title: Scared my cat but seems to work
customer_reviews.text: Okay so my cat is afraid of the diffuser. But he hasn’t had urinary issues since I plugged them in. For the first day after purchase, my young very jumpy/anxious cat wouldn’t go within two feet of where this diffuser was plugged in. He tentatively approached it once, but it, and ran away. Now he isn’t as scared, but still doesn’t get near it. I purchased for stress-related health & bladder issues that seem to have improved since. Seems worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, FIRE/SAFETY HAZARD
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend against purchasing these diffusers, as they are simply dangerous. The oil doesn't get diffused, it collects on the outside of the oil heater and congealed/crystallizes. The oil will drip down and stain/ruin anything below it. The oil is listed as not safe for consumption by your pets (or humans for that matter), and yet this device seems to be a nearly optimal method of spreading the oil across the floors/wall, where your cat might eat it. Finally, it's an outright fire hazard. When we removed the diffuser from the outlet, we realized the oil had wicked into the outlet prongs themselves. Do not buy. Just get the spray and use that instead.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Geringer

customer_reviews.title: I cannot praise this product enough !!
customer_reviews.text: Had to take our Siamese cat to the vet and when I made the appointment I warned them he might need to be sedated for the exam because he is so mean and it’s worse since he is injured too. We got to the office and they put us in s little room for cats and this cat let them do everything without a single growl I was praising them and they laughed and said it was FELIWAY. I was so impressed that I bought one from the vet ($49) so I looked to Amazon to save my pocket book and low and behold there it was much cheaper and amazing as ever.
customer_reviews.author: Catrina Gann

customer_reviews.title: Only seems to effect one of two cats
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this based off of a vet recommendation (so most likely really does work), because our one cat has anxiety and runs around like crazy and hides whenever something happens. Plugged it one in upstairs and one downstairs. After a couple of hours our other cat seemed to notice and went up to them and sniffed them. (Shes always been calm and not problems) so it seems they can sense it. However after both ran out we never saw a noticeable difference in our cat that has the anxiety. Always worth a try to help out our pets though.
customer_reviews.author: Casey From Ohio

customer_reviews.title: So far so good for anxiety relief
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. About one full week of use here and seems my one year old male cat is a bit mellower. Maybe too mellow. Almost seems stoned LOL. But he is calmer for sure. No real diff with our female of same age. Keeping an eye, but no issues (as of yet) with the diffusers. Using 2 in about a 1,000 sq ft space at opposite ends. One is the multi-cat the other is classic for anxiety.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Greene

customer_reviews.title: No smell at all
customer_reviews.text: I only had this for a few days before my elder cat passed so I can’t really say if it worked or not. I can say when I was looking at ordering it I was worried it would have a smell that would be strong but when I got it and plugged it in I was surprised to me it only had a slight smell not bad at all. If I get another cat I will try it again
customer_reviews.author: meghan

customer_reviews.title: Diffuser overheats quickly
customer_reviews.text: I just received this diffuser for my anxious cat. Hesitant of the reviews still bought it. Well, I can see why, because it hasn't been 2 hours since I plugged it for the first time and it is extremely hot. It is not normal that it overheats so quickly! I also have a couple of glade plugins that have been on for weeks and are not that hot, so it is not issue with my house outlets. Sorry Amazon :( I will be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

product_meta.title: FELIWAY Classic 30 Day Starter Kit Plug-in Diffuser & Refill for Cat
product_meta.description: Size:48 mlIs your cat peeing outside the litter box, scratching your furniture and carpet, or hiding on a regular basis? These behaviors may be caused by fear and anxiety. FELIWAY products are a vet recommended, drug free, and clinically proven to help alleviate many of the unwanted behaviors cat owners deal with. FELIWAY CLASSIC provides “happy messages” by mimicking the natural feline reassuring messages (pheromones) to make cats feel calm and comfortable at home. This product has been found to reduce scratching, spraying, and hiding for 90% of cats, and many owners see results within 7 days. Cats are also very sensitive to change, so if you anticipate changes in the home (moving, renovation, recorating, new pets, new family members, etcs.), FELIWAY is very effective in helping your cats remain calm, and adapt to the changes without unwanted behaviors. The FELIWAY Classic Diffuser Kit includes one diffuser, and one refill vial. You should plug your diffuser in the room(s) where your cat spends the most time - each diffuser covers up to 700 sq. feet. Make sure your diffuser isn't covered by curtains, or behind furniture. Each refill can last up to 30 days. For maximum effectiveness, you should replace your diffuser every 6 months. Make sure to follow the instructions when plugging in your diffuser, and plug the diffuser in upright.
feature_bullets: VET RECOMMENDED: Feliway Classic is the #1 vet recommended solution to help cats adjust to challenging situations and curb stress related unwanted behaviors
REDUCES SCRATCHING AND URINE SPRAYING: Clinically proven to reduce scratching and urine spraying in 9/10 cats. Results may be seen as early as 7 days
DRUG FREE SOLUTION: Our diffuser emits an odorless copy of the facial Pheromone which helps cats feel more comfortable, and less stressed in their environment

COVERS UP TO 700 SQ FEET: For best results, the Feliway Classic Diffuser should be plugged in continuoulsy in the room where the cat spends the most time, and you should avoid plugging in the diffuser under shelves and behind doors, curtains and furniture
LASTS UP TO 4 WEEKS: Our starter kit includes one diffuser head and one refill - to maximize effectiveness, replace the vial every 4 weeks, and the diffuser every 6 months

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
